edu.uoc.som.jarvis.core.recognition

Interface IntentRecognitionProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultIntentRecognitionProvider, DialogFlowApi

    public interface IntentRecognitionProvider
    A unified wrapper for concrete intent recognition providers.

    This interface provides utility methods to connect to a given intent recognition provider, register and delete IntentDefinitions, create JarvisSessions, and compute the RecognizedIntent from a given input text.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JarvisSession createSession(String sessionId)
      Creates a new JarvisSession from the provided sessionId.
      void deleteIntentDefinition(IntentDefinition intentDefinition)

      void trainMLEngine()
      Trains the underlying intent recognition provider.

    • Method Detail

      • registerIntentDefinition

        void registerIntentDefinition(IntentDefinition intentDefinition)
        Registers the provided intentDefinition in the underlying intent recognition provider.

        Note: unless explicitly stated in subclasses, this method does not train the underlying machine learning engine, so multiple intent registrations does not generate multiple training calls. Once all the IntentDefinitions have been registered in the underlying intent recognition provider use trainMLEngine() to train the ML engine.

        Parameters:
        intentDefinition - the IntentDefinition to register to the underlying intent recognition provider
        See Also:
        trainMLEngine()

      • deleteIntentDefinition

        void deleteIntentDefinition(IntentDefinition intentDefinition)
        Deletes the provided intentDefinition from the underlying intent recognition provider.

        Note: unless explicitly stated in subclasses, this method does not train the underlying machine learning engine, so multiple intent deletion does not generate multiple training calls. Once all the IntentDefinitions have been deleted from the underlying intent recognition provider use trainMLEngine() to train the ML engine.

        Parameters:
        intentDefinition - the IntentDefinition to delete from the underlying intent recognition provider
        See Also:
        trainMLEngine()

      • trainMLEngine

        void trainMLEngine()
        Trains the underlying intent recognition provider.

        Note: this method returns once the intent recognition provider's training is complete. However, the propagation of the training information may not be complete when this method returns.

      • createSession

        JarvisSession createSession(String sessionId)
        Creates a new JarvisSession from the provided sessionId.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - the identifier to create a session from
        Returns:
        a new JarvisSession for the provided sessionId

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Shuts down the intent recognition provider client and invalidates the remaining sessions.

        Note: calling this method invalidates the intent recognition provider client connection, and thus this class cannot be used to access the intent recognition provider anymore.

      • isShutdown

        boolean isShutdown()
        Returns whether the intent recognition provider client is shutdown.
        Returns:
        true if the intent recognition provider client is shutdown, false otherwise

      • getIntent

        RecognizedIntent getIntent(String input,
                           JarvisSession session)
        Returns the RecognizedIntent extracted from te provided input.

        This method uses the provided session to extract contextual intents, such as follow-up or context-based intents.

        Parameters:
        input - the String representing the textual input to process and extract the intent from
        session - the JarvisSession used to access context information
        Returns:
        the RecognizedIntent extracted from the provided input and session
